title: PreciousMetapsICT
author: PreciousMetapsICT
created_time: February 25, 2023, 10:03:36 PMLast edit: February 26, 2023, 06:46:44 PM by PreciousMetapsICT
content: Looking for redemption ballets from the cardsmiths currency trading cards series. Any crypto - Any denom (probably can’t swing the full btc one  ) would really like a doge and eth one as well as a .001 btc that I’ve heard about but not seen.Like ones pictured here: https://imgur.com/a/GjQnOJ2Thanks for your help!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: was there a doge one? I have a BTC and a LTC one - didnt know about the doge one - if you find someone with more than one of those please send em my way.

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on February 26, 2023, 07:17:04 PMwas there a doge one? I have a BTC and a LTC one - didnt know about the doge one - if you find someone with more than one of those please send em my way. I’ve only seen the LTC and .01 btc versions but according to the website there are eth and doge as well. From their website…“ Along with rare foil variants, such as our proprietary Gemstone Refractors™, we have randomly inserted redemption codes into Series 1 packs that award fortunate finders with various amounts of cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, Litecoin, and Dogecoin. Some of the codes are even redeemable for an entire Bitcoin!  Don’t let history pass you by. Start building your CURRENCY Series 1 trading card collection today! Approximate odds of finding per pack: Base Card Parallels: Holofoil 1:1, Crystal Sparkle 1:2, Gemstone Refractor™ 1:10, Cryptocurrency Redemption Code 1:96, Meta-Rare Refractor™ 1:124. “Will send them your way if I get any offers but crickets so far

comments.author: montreal1
comments.body: I have an eth denominated card so I can confirm they exist. I don’t think I’d want to part ways with it though

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: well damn I need to get those as well for my ballet collection

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: Quote from: montreal1 on February 26, 2023, 09:23:40 PMI have an eth denominated card so I can confirm they exist. I don’t think I’d want to part ways with it though What denomination? Guessing I’d say .01 but would be really cool if it was a .1 or full one. Honestly don’t know what all they came in

comments.author: montreal1
comments.body: Quote from: PreciousMetapsICT on February 26, 2023, 10:38:17 PMQuote from: montreal1 on February 26, 2023, 09:23:40 PMI have an eth denominated card so I can confirm they exist. I don’t think I’d want to part ways with it though What denomination? Guessing I’d say .01 but would be really cool if it was a .1 or full one. Honestly don’t know what all they came in it's a .1 here is what they look like

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: From one of the creators on a different post… https://imgur.com/a/OjAO6Xq    “The higher denom redemption amounts like 1 BTC, 1 ETH, 5k DOGE and0.1 BTC will be the standard (non-customized) Ballet Metal cards due to their higher value. That was a stipulation that Ballet had as they didn't want any super-high values on the custom, plastic cards.The Cardsmiths Ballet cards will be for the 1 LTC, 0.01 BTC, 0.001 BTC and 0.1 ETH denominations.”So as far as custom ballets it’s just going to be 1 LTC, .01 btc, .001 btc, and .1 Eth

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: Quote from: PreciousMetapsICT on February 26, 2023, 11:37:32 PMFrom one of the creators on a different post… https://imgur.com/a/OjAO6Xq    “The higher denom redemption amounts like 1 BTC, 1 ETH, 5k DOGE and0.1 BTC will be the standard (non-customized) Ballet Metal cards due to their higher value. That was a stipulation that Ballet had as they didn't want any super-high values on the custom, plastic cards.The Cardsmiths Ballet cards will be for the 1 LTC, 0.01 BTC, 0.001 BTC and 0.1 ETH denominations.”So as far as custom ballets it’s just going to be 1 LTC, .01 btc, .001 btc, and .1 Ethwell if they are just putting the 4 higher ones on regular ballets (I have many of those) I am ok if I cant find those to collect. I have the 1 LTC and the .01 BTC but I need to find the .01 btc, .001 btc and the .1 eth cards.

comments.author: geophphreigh
comments.body: Quote from: montreal1 on February 26, 2023, 10:48:56 PMit's a .1 here is what they look likeWow. I have not seen anything other than the 0.01BTC and the 1LTC cards. Nice to see an ETH card in the wild, not sure how I am going to get one of these, they seem more rare than the two above. Geo

comments.author: Otillio1330
comments.body: That’s really cool. Haven’t seen the ETH one before. I have 2 of the .01 BTC version (not looking to sell or trade) and another 12 pack of cards coming in this week. Hope I can get lucky again and score an LTC or an ETH.

comments.body: Anyone have a picture of the .001 btc wallet? Still looking for that one

comments.author: PreciousMetapsICT
comments.body: Confirmed with Cardsmiths that the .001 redemptions are not custom ballet cards. I’m assuming they are the standard ballet white and orange pure series loaded/denominated with .001 btc. So only custom cardsmiths ballets - listed from most common to least common (my opinion based on what I’ve seen only) - .01 Btc, 1 Ltc, .1 Eth

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: well i probably will not send in the .001 if its just a generic wallet.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: as a follow up - I have gotten the following response from cardsmiths:QuoteThat was the original intention, but Ballet more or less insisted that we just use their branded card for that particular denomination.I think that pretty sad that Ballet would insist that a customer use their generic card vs being willing to process their order for custom cards.I love ballet but this is mehIt cannot be the denomination - as ballet has printed hundreds of custom btc cards for way lower denoms like .0001 BTC
